subject: History
title: The Taiping Rebellion
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Taiping Rebellion.

hook.text: A failed Chinese exam student claimed to be Jesus's brother and started a war that killed 20 million people.

buildup.text: Hong Xiuquan founded the Taiping Heavenly Kingdom, blending Christianity with Chinese millenarian beliefs.

discovery.text: His followers conquered a third of China, establishing a rival state with radical social reforms.

twist.text: The Taiping banned opium, foot-binding, and private property. Western powers, fearing chaos, sided with the Qing.

climax.text: The rebellion was crushed in 1864 after 14 years. Its death toll exceeded World War Iâ€”in a conflict few Westerners know.

punchline.text: History's deadliest civil war is barely remembered.

quiz.question: Why did Western powers support the Qing dynasty against the Taiping?
options: They feared the Taiping's radical reforms and regional instability
They wanted to convert the Taiping to Protestantism
The Qing promised them exclusive trade rights
